text: Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.
text.1: You will be on the front-lines developing responses to a variety of inquiries from our healthcare providers, collaborators, and patients. This position is responsible for compiling and analyzing data to respond to client inquiries.

li: Perform risk-based assessments of occurrences and urgent inquiries, drawing on molecular genetics and clinical testing experience to prioritize investigations while balancing customer needs against the team=E2=80=99s available resources
li.1: Aggregate and present data for root cause analysis and CAPAs as appropriate
li.2: Work closely with Lab Directors in collaboration with the Client Services, ClinConsult, and Medical teams to investigate and analyze issues and strive for utmost client satisfaction with the entire Invitae experience
li.3: Explore data to assess continuous process improvements following resolution of escalated inquiries in order to enhance internal processes and client satisfaction
li.4: Provide clear, concise written and oral communication including of technical findings to non-technical teammates

text: When laboratory issues are identified as a result of client inquiries, initiate incident reports and ensure appropriate documentation.

li: Expert in Python data management and problem solving
li.1: Strong knowledge of querying databases: SQL, datalog, etc.
li.2: Knowledge of human molecular genetics and experience in a clinical testing laboratory
li.3: Understanding of NGS results, data analysis, and variant interpretation
li.4: Ability to understand customers=E2=80=99 questions and translate to an actionable analysis plan
li.5: Excellent trouble-shooting skills: Ability to successfully analyze problems and propose solutions to the medical escalation investigation leadership.
li.6: Experience working within a knowledge management and documentation management environment
li.7: Preference for industry experience in healthcare, biotech, and/or life sciences. Bonus: Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction and next-generation sequencing (NGS) wet lab protocols, preferably in a production setting.

text: Preferred PhD, MS or equivalent experience
